infotexts.entitydescription.WR_baton: Often seen in the hands of officers and wardens; useful for discipline or moving prisoners.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_trenchingtool: A simple tool used to erect fortifications or dig trenchs.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_medkit: A small metal container designed to carry medical supplies.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_medbag: A medical kit that carries large medical items. Can be wore as a bag.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_revolverammobox: A small box that holds 60 rounds of revolver ammo.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_rifleammobox: A box that holds 40 rounds of rifle ammo.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_shotgunammobox: A box that holds 40 rounds of shotgun ammo.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_cuffs: Rope handcuffs, crude but effective at restraining prisoners.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_coalitionhelmet: Standard issue steel helmet. Protective against artillery shells, but not fire-arms.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_coalitionmedhelmet: Same as a normal helmet, but red with a white cross for medic identification.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_renegadehelmet: A flat rim helmet with netting over the top. Protective against artillery shells, but not gun-fire.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_renegademedhelmet: Similar to a standard helmet, but red with a white cross for medic identification.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_renegadecomhat: A fine piece of Separatist headgear. Simply wearing this can inspire confidence in those around you.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_coalitioncomhat: Headdress for any stalwart Coalition officer.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_coalitiongear: Standard issue equipment for Coalition soldiers. Has pockets to hold anything from meds to ammo.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_coalitionmedgear: Standard issue rig for Coalition physicians. Has surgical gear that makes medical procedures more effective.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_renegadegear: Renegade's gear: a waist belt with pockets, tied together with a camo colored bandolier.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_renegademedgear: Renegade medic's gear: two large side packs on a waist belt, and a medical bandolier filled with surgical equipment.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_coalitionuniform: Standard issue uniform consisting of a horizon blue tunic, trousers and ankle boots topped with puttees.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_renegadeuniform: A uniform consisting of a army green trench coat, trousers and boots topped with leg wraps.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_powhandler: A chain switch that removes POWs.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_strategicexchange: A place were ammo and weapons from the home front are sent and, with the right amount money, can be bought.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_currency: A brass coin made as a alternative to the Mark to better withstand battlefield conditions. Respected, produced and used by both the Coalition and Renegades.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_footlocker: Stores the belongings of a captive.
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_objective: A 10mx10m that defines a area objective. Tags: defender="" attacker="" winnerifcaptured="" - defender and attacker are job identifiers for Lua, while winnerifcaptured is just the name of the attacker team in the end messsage (if you wish to have spaces in the winner tag please use '_').
infotexts.entitydescription.WR_guide: Contains useful info for NML's mechanics.
infotexts.WR_guide_contents:
THIS GUIDE IS A WORK IN PROGRESS AND AS SUCH IS NON-COMPREHENSIVE

This guide provides a detailed breakdown of NML’s mechanics and rules.

The rules of war:
 -Do not kill those who can't fight (POWs, surrendering soldiers and wounded):
This does NOT mean you can’t hurt those in the provided list; killing is the only punishable offense.
 -False surrender is prohibited:
Hostilities (stealing and combat) after surrendering, to avoid being injured cuffing yourself is recommended.

Healing refactor:
Morphine and blood have an affliction for healing meaning pass the max capacity, medicine will be wasted.
Bleeding will drain healing afflictions and make medicine less efficient; bleeding should be patched FIRST before other treatment.

Inventory rebalance:
Items such as ammo and meds will have a small stack size when not in a medkit or carrier.
Large items (bloodpacks, grenades and magazines) have to be placed in special slots in your chest rig (marked with an icon), soldier rigs can hold grenades and magazines but not blood packs and vice versa for medical rigs and trauma kits.

POW mechanics:
A prisoner is define as: someone who is cuffed, not dead and not on the same team.
Captured prisoners can be turned to currency via a pull switch located in landmarks (landmarks have signs) and the bunker brig (the prisoner does not need to be fully healed). Money can be used at a shop called the Strategic Exchange located above the spawn bunker.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.WR_suppression: The soldier is reluctant to move.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.WR_suppression.sel: Your mobility and composure is compromised by fear, after all its best not to drown in a sea of rounds.
